title: Calories in Mexican Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in mexican rice per cup, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and recipe tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Standard homemade or restaurant-style Mexican rice (arroz rojo) cooked with white rice, tomatoes, onions, garlic, green peppers, and vegetable oil; about 195g per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of Mexican rice provides ~242 kcal, mostly from carbs with some fat from cooking oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of Mexican rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 242 kcal per cup (195g) based on standard recipe.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in Mexican rice?
faqs.a: About 42g carbs per cup, including 2.9g fiber and 3.1g sugars.

faqs.q: Is Mexican rice high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 585mg sodium per cup due to seasonings and tomatoes.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in Mexican rice?
faqs.a: More oil or butter increases fat and calories; steaming reduces them.
Roughly 5g protein per cup; adding meat or beans boosts it.
